content: weekend to give the campfire blanket a test drive since then it has been brought out by many campfires and it works perfectly campfire blanket v 1 1 05/23 © seth richardson 2020-2023 page 2 materials & miscellany size small throw measurements 61 /155 cm long and 39 /99 cm wide after blocking yarn brooklyn tweed dapple dk weight 60% merino wool/40% organic cotton 165 yards/150 meters per 50g skein two strands of the same colorway are held together throughout the pattern an approximate total of 4 000 yards in the following colorways canopy c1 396 yds/3 skeins cerise c6 340 yds/3 skeins anchor c2 1 010 yds/7 skeins honeycrisp c7 264 yds/2 skeins blueprint c3 528 yds/4 skeins medallion c8 198 yds/2 skeins cosmos c4 528 yds/4 skeins seafoam c9 396 yds/3 skeins plinth c5 340 yds/3 skeins a note on yarn substitution feel free to substitute yarn for this pattern you can dig through your stash to see what you already have and mix and match yarns or see what other kinds of yarn you can find at your local yarn shop or craft store the important thing to note is that the original design was created with two matching strands of dk weight yarn held together which makes a thicker yarn when combined if you choose to work with a single strand you can get gauge on a yarn in the range of worsted weight heavy worsted or aran weight yarn just note that it will make a difference in your yardage requirements those listed for dapple above account for the yardage needed to hold it double also you can use my plan exactly how i ve written it or go ahead and change the palette completely maybe even throw in a marled stripe here and there there are lots of possibilities so have fun getting creative with color needles us 9 5 5mm 40 circular needles or size needed to obtain gauge the length of the cord is not crucial so long as the full 39 width of the blanket can fit comfortably on the circulars gauge 16 5 stitches and 31 5 row = 4 /10 cm in garter stitch after blocking tools tapestry needle to weave in ends skill level beginner skills required long tail cast on icelandic bind off optional show off your use the hashtag #thebestcampfireblanket on social media to share your work progress abbreviations c1 -9 color 1 through 9 co cast on rs right side st s stitch es ws wrong side campfire blanket v 1 1 05/23 © seth richardson 2020-2023 page 3 construction notes this blanket is worked flat width-wise since the entire piece is done using garter stitch every stitch will be a knit stitch whether you are on the rs or the ws this makes it a great beginner s project and
